title: The perfect Mexican menu for a Day of the Dead feast, from carnitas to chocolate tart
text:
I’m holding my hands up here: I love a theme. I am that person who embraces fancy dress with gusto. Give me papier mache, set dressing, or a party and I am fully on board. I am less keen, however, on the commercialism of certain holidays (Christmas decorations on sale in August? I just don’t get it!)

And while I don’t think we need to fill our lives with more plastic tat, a holiday that has meaning and a reason to celebrate is a winner in my eyes.

After a trip to Mexico and understanding what Day of the Dead means, I became enthralled with this colourful, enigmatic day. A celebration of those gone before us is one worth having.

But if that’s not your bag, and you just love hosting a dinner party,...
